parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Preposition
str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Demonstrative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Adverb
str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To turn away, pervert, remove; I restore, replace; mid: I desert, reject. From apo and strepho; to turn away or back.

parse: Article - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From ana and krino; properly, to scrutinize, i.e. investigate, interrogate, determine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Preposition
str2: Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Noun - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: No one, none, nothing.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: The cause, author; the culprit, the accused; the crime. From the same as aiteo; causative, i.e. a causer.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To accuse, charge, prosecute. From kategoros; to be a plaintiff, i.e. To charge with some offence.

parse: Preposition
str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
